title: Honoring United States National Track Team member Amy Palmeiro-Winters upon the occasion of her designation as a recipient of an ESPN ESPY Award
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION honoring United States National Track Team member
Amy Palmeiro-Winters upon the occasion of her designation as a recipient
of an ESPN ESPY Award

WHEREAS,  It  is  the  sense  of this Legislative Body to pay tribute to
those individuals with disabilities whose personal triumphs and extraor-
dinary spirit and determination are an inspiration to others; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions,  this  Legislative  Body  is justly proud to honor
United States National Track Team member Amy Palmeiro-Winters  upon  the
occasion of her designation as a recipient of an ESPN ESPY Award; and
  WHEREAS,  The road has been long and winding for Hicksville, New York,
resident Amy Palmeiro-Winters; after a motorcycle accident  severed  her
left  leg  in  1994,  she  has gone on to conquer the competition in the
ultra marathon world, with  one  of  her  latest  feats  coming  in  Los
Angeles,  California,  as  she  earned  her  first ESPY, the Best Female
Athlete with a Disability ESPY Award; and
  WHEREAS, In  spite  of  expert  opinion,  Amy  Palmeiro-Winters  began
running  again  after 27 surgeries over a three-year span; she has since
experienced tremendous success; the sheer fact that she  kept  motivated
through so much adversity is something few can do; and
  WHEREAS, Amy Palmeiro-Winters returned to running, but ultimately with
a  prosthetic  leg, setting new world records for her running class, and
competed successfully in numerous races, including ultra marathons (50k,
50-mile, 100k, 100 mile and 24 hour  races),  triathlons  including  the
Ironman,  half-Ironman,  and  Olympic  distance races; she mentions that
putting her prosthetic in place every day is like putting on a  pair  of
eyeglasses; and
  WHEREAS,  A  loving  mother  of  two,  Amy Palmeiro-Winters shares her
message with other amputees looking for their second chance in life; she
strives to inspire children and adults alike; and
  WHEREAS, Amy Palmeiro-Winters started running as a child and  competed
in her first race when she was only eight years old; she quickly discov-
ered  the  feeling  of  being  part  of something bigger, part of a team
committed to giving your all to something; and
  WHEREAS, A true asset to society, Amy Palmeiro-Winters attributes  her
success to the power sports has played in her life; working with Aspire,
a  New  York  based nonprofit organization, she helps children and young
adults with limb loss get back to an active healthy  lifestyle,  through
sports, teamwork and education; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is the sense of this Legislative Body that when individ-
uals of such enduring courage and  accomplishment  are  brought  to  our
attention,  they should be celebrated and recognized by all the citizens
of the great State of New York; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor United States National Track Team member Amy Palmeiro-Winters upon
the  occasion  of  her designation as a recipient of an ESPN ESPY Award;
and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Amy Palmeiro-Winters.
